fullText: Audiences may feel the same way after seeing this work of theatrical virtuosity, realizing that all the tiny details, wild rhythms, and clever hooks presented on stage have added up to a work that is brave, purposeful, and rich.
dtliExcerpt: Home Legit Reviews Apr 19, 2024 8:59pm PT ‘Stereophonic’ Review: Behind the Music, Thereâ€™s Theatrical Solid Gold in This New Broadway Play By Frank Rizzo Plus Icon Frank Rizzo Latest ‘Ragtime’ Review: Broadway Revival Is a Timely, Glorious Panorama of Changing Times in America 3 months ago ‘Waiting for Godot’ Review: Keanu Reeves and Alex Winter Bring a Cooler, Cosmic Take to This Broadway Waiting Game 4 months ago ‘Call Me Izzy’ Review: Jean Smart Dazzles in a Broadway Play That Treads All-Too-Familiar Territory 7 months ago See All Julieta Cervantes There's a moment in David Adjmi 's play " Stereophonic " when a discordant, mid-'70s band-on-the rise hears one of its songs played back to them in the recording studio for the first time, with all its multiple tracks layered together into an artful whole. It leaves the ever-bickering band suddenly speechless, emotionally stunned and still with the realization that they have just heard something truly great. llmScore.reasoning: Claude: Strong positive language with multiple superlatives and praise for the production's cohesive artistic achievement, though lacks explicit recommendation language or discussion of individual elements. | GPT-4o-mini: The review highlights the production's artistic qualities and overall impact, indicating a strong recommendation despite not specifying individual elements.
